snippet: Prominent organizers of antigovernment protests in Moscow descended on a southern Russia city to take up the cause of an opposition mayoral candidate who claimed election fraud.
abstract: Prominent organizers of Russia's antigovernment protest movement descend on the southern city of Astrakhan, taking up the cause of opposition mayoral candidate Oleg V Shein, who is in the fourth week of a hunger strike protesting ballot fraud; move signals the movement's emerging focus on regional elections rather than Moscow politics.

byline.contributor: Ellen Barry contributed reporting from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: Prominent organizers of antigovernment protests in Moscow descended on a southern Russia city to take up the cause of an opposition mayoral candidate who claimed election fraud.

headline.seo: Astrakhan Hunger Striker Gets Support From Moscow Protesters
headline.main: Moscow Protesters Try to Expand Movement
headline.print_headline: Moscow Protesters Try to Expand Movement
